channel.title: Towns?
channel.description: I keep seeing all this talk about towns, its seems like a cool idea cause my house i near some very weird structure surrounded by a fence, never really studied it but it looks odd Anyways, what I'm saying is, what towns are there and how do you move into them? It seems that you need to ask permission of the other townsfolk, but I'd like to know more :)

item.title: Towns?
item.dc:creator: @SpeedIsHim SpeedIsHim
item.description:
@SpeedIsHim wrote:

Sure thing

Read full topic

[quote=“SpeedIsHim, post:39, topic:398133”]The only hidden chests I know in your city have torches in the very same room.

[quote author=noobs are ftw link=topic=494607.msg3617798#msg3617798 date=1307132916]
i dont use xray i use the gravel trick btw lol

this topic is aimed at me and mongol right? we keep changing render to see torches and gravel trick for chests so yea we dont xray
[/quote][/quote]
There was a hidden room with a chest hidden behind a wall in that room that was torch free.

As I’ve Learnt ;)[/quote]

Until some of them use xray -.-

item.title: Towns?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

LilXCj:

They were desperate for something. To see something other than the island. To see something other than the fear that began eating away at them. Still it’s going off topic.

Mm… it’s all relevant.

Read full topic

item.title: Towns?
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

They were desperate for something. To see something other than the island. To see something other than the fear that began eating away at them. Still it’s going off topic.

item.title: Towns?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:26, topic:398133”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=495265.msg3621651#msg3621651 date=1307476473]

If you’ve read ‘lord of the flies’, then you’ll see stuff like that pop up often.

Oh I read it. All it taught me is that if you’re desperate for something you’ll steep as low as killing your own friends.

But they where desperate for anything, for they where driven by fear and evil.
[/quote]

Irrelevant to the main topic. Don’t try to justify your actions because you “need anything”. Minecraft has a lot of resources that you could work for yourself.[/quote]

Oops. that was a typo.
I mean to say they weren’t desperate for anything. The island provided food (fruits, pigs), plenty of trees for houses, and plenty of rocks for spears. Variables like that where removed. It was the idea of how governmental systems would form. Typically, in most cities (for minecraft), it’s either a voted leader (if it’s a team effort), or the one who builds the city. Their reign is typically fair, as we’ve never really had a dictatorship, or any form of socialism. In this game, if you don’t like your leader, you could just pack up your stuff, kill him and leave.

Read full topic

Irrelevant to the main topic. Don’t try to justify your actions because you “need anything”. Minecraft has a lot of resources that you could work for yourself.

@LilXCj wrote:

The thing is that I’d rather not stoop as low as them when it comes to “needing resources” nor in the idea that everyone is my enemy and I have to defend my land because of it. Everyone on the server has become so paranoid that they kill anyone that isn’t part of their inner circle. It’s just so stupid.

item.title: Towns?
item.dc:creator: @Kurisu Kurisu
item.description:
@Kurisu wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:17, topic:398133”]Just find a partner, venture far out into the map nowhere near anyone and start your own little town. Bootnecklad and I did just that; we walked and walked for quite a long time, had to make several temporary shelters on the way, but finally found a nice spot.

If you want to be really cautious, you could do what we did, and make your town/base underground. It’s probably best to stay as close to bedrock as possible as there are a lot more minerals down there.

Good luck!

ps, rey I’ll probably come back one day (not any time soon though)[/quote]
Yeah I found a nice place underground so I should be good

Read full topic

I want to live in sombodys town, my roommate quit minecraft:/

item.title: Towns?
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:11, topic:398133”][quote author=badger41 link=topic=495265.msg3621145#msg3621145 date=1307417092]

Nations rise and fall. rather quickly, too.

Because you won’t cool your bum and just live like a normal person.

You live alone in the ruins of a ONCE great nation. It’s downfall? People wanted change. That city didn’t offer anything special. It had a quick rise, reaching 14 people, but within a week, 6 people were left. That’s what happens when it’s open to the general public. You get nomads (kinda). They stay, get shit, maybe a bit of stealing, pack up and leave. Agl and I (currently just me rofl) have a whitelist for our city, and we’ve gained 2 members and lost 1. However, the overall ratio of total joiners to leavers is 5:1.

Last time i checked, your city doesnt have anything spectacular either.
[/quote]
We have the minecraft trade centers (building 2 65% done)[/quote]

rey dont forget the mob system and cactus farm

Read full topic

item.title: Towns?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Just find a partner, venture far out into the map nowhere near anyone and start your own little town. Bootnecklad and I did just that; we walked and walked for quite a long time, had to make several temporary shelters on the way, but finally found a nice spot.

If you want to be really cautious, you could do what we did, and make your town/base underground. It’s probably best to stay as close to bedrock as possible as there are a lot more minerals down there.

Good luck!

ps, rey I’ll probably come back one day (not any time soon though)

Read full topic
